page.title: 01UPPER ANNANDALE
page.content: { Introduction { }The town of Moffat lies in the Annandale Valley and is surrounded by the soft rolling hills of Dumfriesshire.The town is two miles off the main A74 England to Scotland trunk road and is two to three hours drive from the northern central belt of England.In fact London is only six hours drive from Moffat which has a population of about 2030 people. Edinburgh,Glasgow,the East and West coast are within an hours drive from Moffat,which makes it an ideal base for exploring the Borders and S. W.Scotland.Alternatively Moffat offers the ideal overnight stop if you are travelling North or South. The town is well provided with a wide variety of ammenities for visitors but still remains a centre for the centuries-old sheep industry.
